Belgia: 1591. October:
Belgia 1592 7 Octo
b
[to]
M
r
Bodly
William Waad
After o
r
hartie Commendac
o
ns yo
u
shall understand that
Mons
r
Charon
hathe
p
r
sented unto hir Ma
tie
the forme of a placa r d intended to be published by the Estates
of the united provinces w
ch
he hath shewed to hir Ma
tie
not as a thinge fully Resolved
but conceaved by them to aunswere the demand made by
hir Ma
tie
for the Restraint
of the transportacon of victuells in to
Spaine
and the west
tes And becawse
her Ma
tie
doth finde the imperfecti
o
of the said Placard, not satisfyeng her expectacon
and that w
ch
they in all regard of reason ought to have
formed in the prohibicon of
victuels and graine to be transported into Spaine and the west
tes: her highnes
hath thought good to note the same by this declaracon w
ch
yo
u
shall receave herew
th
all to imparte unto them wherein yo
u
may se these waightie reasons w
ch
her Ma
tie
doth urge to make them consider better of this matter, w
ch
her pleasure
is
yo
u
shall
maintaine and fortefie w
th
such argument and reasons as yo
u
shall think meet
and serving to that pu
r
pose Moreover whereas [dudst] thinges have ben
pounded
unto them both by yo
u
and
M
r
Wilkes
at his last being there whereunto as yet
they have geven no
full
aunswer nor satisfaction, yo
u
may hereby take occasion
to put them againe in mynd of those matters that her Ma
tie
may at the length
receave their resolucon
And so fare yo
u
well from the Court at
Otlandes
the
7
th
of October 1591
